title: H2O2 decomp - signs of free energy and entropy

content.description:
2 H2O2(aq) → 2 H2O(l) + O2(g)        ΔH° = −196 kJ/molrxn

The decomposition of H2O2(aq) is represented by the equation above. A student monitored the decomposition of a 1.0 L sample of H2O2(aq) at a constant temperature of 300. K and recorded the concentration of H2O2 as a function of time. The results are given in the table below.
content.question: The reaction is thermodynamically favorable. The signs of ΔG° and ΔS° for the reaction are which of the following?

topic.text: 9.3: Gibbs Free Energy and Thermodynamic Favorability

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
